column.name: CYCLE_NAME
column.comment: This is the name of the cycle associated to the mailing for the document pattern of the account related to the bill period at the time the bill period was created. -  This is the name of the Cycle associated with the Account. The Cycle  determines when i

column.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
column.comment: The effective Date of the Email Validation - The Access Information is effective dated.

column.name: CHANGE_TYPE
column.comment: Data warehouse entry last action type: "I"-Inserted, "U"-Updated, "D"-Deleted.

column.name: LOADTM
column.comment: - data warehouse entry change date timestamp (Original name in the DWHDB "_LOADTM")

column.name: EFFECTIVE_STATUS
column.comment: Effective Status of Email Validation - The effective status determines if the Access Information is active or inactive at that point in time.

column.name: CYCLE_TYPE
column.comment: The type of Cycle.

column.name: DUE_DATE_TIME
column.comment: The start date and time of the cycle

column.name: HOLIDAY_INDICATOR
column.comment: Indicates if the Cycle is supposed to run during holidayy days. every two months. (populated only for Cycles with CYCLE_TYPE Periodic)

column.name: LOCK_INDICATOR
column.comment: Indicates if the Cycle is locked

column.name: BILL_VERIFICATION_INDICATOR
column.comment: Bill verification indicator

column.name: CYCLE_GROUP_RD
column.comment: Type of the cycle. Possible values are BILL, NON_BILL, REPRINT, and  ON_DEMAND_BILL.

column.name: AUDIT_UPDATE_USER_ID
column.comment: Audit information capturing user id of last update - Audit information capturing user id of last update

column.name: AUDIT_UPDATE_DATE_TIME
column.comment: Audit information capturing date and time of last update - Audit information capturing date and time of last update

column.name: UPDATE_NUMBER
column.comment: - Version number of the row. The version number starts with a random number and is incremented on each update. Update and Delete operations verify that the number in the database is equal to the number used in the SQL statement (optimistic locking).

column.name: DESCRIPTION_STRING
column.comment: DESCRIPTION_STRING -  A textual description of the account for informational used by the  customer or customer representative.

column.name: CUSTOMER_CATEGORY_RD
column.comment: Customer category.

column.name: CUSTOMER_CLASSIFICATION_RD
column.comment: Customer classification.

column.name: INVOICE_CYCLE_NAME
column.comment: Cycle name of the invoice cycle for an Extract Cycle.

column.name: PRICING_DELAY
column.comment: The delay, in seconds, between the time a Cycle is due and the time pricing should be  started for the Cycle. If this field is NULL, it means that the Pricing Delay for this Cycle will  come from reference data.

column.name: MIN_BATCH_SIZE
column.comment: The minimum size for Production Batches for this Cycle. If this field is NULL, it means that  the Minimum Batch Size for this Cycle will come from reference data.

column.name: PERIOD_CODE
column.comment: The billing period (populated only for Cycles with CYCLE_TYPE  Periodic): YEARL MNTHL OFMNT (Offset monthly) WEKLY DAILY HOURL MINUT (per  minute)

column.name: INTERVAL
column.comment: Used in conjunction with "Period" to specify the scheduling of a  periodic cycle. For example, a Cycle with a Period of 'monthly' and  an Interval of '2' will be due once

column.name: PRINT_DELAY
column.comment: delay to start printing after the documents are produced

column.name: RERUN_DELAY
column.comment: Store the rerun_delay between the due date of the Cycle and the rerun  due date.. If the rerun due date is before the next cycle due date, th  e rerun delay is NULL. If it`s after, the rerun delay is the actual da  te.

column.name: RERUN_DUE_DATE
column.comment: Cycle Rerun Due date time. This value is supplied by the GUI.

column.name: EFFECTIVE_FLAG
column.comment: - Flagging of entries according to EFFECTIVE_DATE maintained by source system (EFFONL). "N" (now) - currently valid entry, "P" (past) - entry that was valid some then in the past, "F" (future) - entity will be valid in the future.

column.name: HISTFLAG
column.comment: Same function as EFFECTIVE_FLAG. The field was initially introduced and maintained in data warehouse before EFFECTIVE_FLAG has been introduced in source system and now kept for compatibility reasons.Just remapping of EFFECTIVE_FLAG -> HISTFLAG:"N" -> "A""
